page.title: 12EDUCATION IN BALSALL COMMON
page.content: The school was extended in 1932 with extra classrooms and a science laboratory. Electricity was put in to light the school but water was still pumped from outside until the 1950's and there were outside toilets. During the war the school was used as a resting area for the people living in Coventry suffering from air raids and for evacuees. Hot dinners were introduced in 1946. A swimming pool was added with the help of the P.T.A. in 1970. The size of the village increased and the school became more and more overcrowded until in 1979 with numbers of over 500 a new school was built attached to the old one. This gave us six more classes and a new hall. We still use four temporary huts. MARK WILKINSON
